official_title: To designate April 28, 1989, as "Workers Memorial Day".

summary.text: Designates April 28, 1989, as Workers Memorial Day in tribute to those workers who have lost their lives because of work place injuries and illnesses. Directs the Congress to rededicate itself through appropriate legislation to strengthening occupational safety and health protection.

titles.title: To designate April 28, 1989, as "Workers Memorial Day".
